discussion.content:
A WAN Edge Device is deployed through the market place within a VNET via MS Azure.
This is the most accurate statement.

This is rather a vague question, "what does it require to function", if this means to connect to on-prem or another head-end, then a public | private subnets are needed, the MS routing architecture takes care of the rest via NSG's. pairing VNets and allowing traffic to and from a security device such as a VFaaS

Selected Answer: D
Should be correct

choices.A: CSR is the WAN Edge device that is supported in the Microsoft cloud. The Microsoft underlay cloud fabric performs the management function.
choices.C: One public subnet is required in VNet. The Microsoft underlay cloud fabric performs all of the routing functions for WAN Edge.
choices.B: There must be three subnets in VNet: management, public, and services.
choices.D: Public and services subnets are required in VNet. The Microsoft underlay cloud fabric performs the management function.

questions.question_text: How many subnets are necessary in Azure VNet for a WAN Edge device to function in the cloud deployment?
Which two sets of identifiers does OMP carry when it advertises TLOC routes between WAN Edge routers? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
According to the Cisco White Paper the identifiers that OMP carry when advertising TLOC routes to
WAN Edge devices are:-

System IP address of the OMP speaker that originates the OMP route
Color to identify the link type
Encapsulation type on the transport tunnel

Origin—(Source of the route, such as BGP, OSPF, connected, and static, and the metric associated with the original route).
Originator— (OMP identifier of the originator of the route, which is the IP address from which the route was learned).
Preference—(Degree of preference for an OMP route. A higher preference value is more preferred).
Service—(Network service associated with the OMP route).
Site ID— (Identifier of a site within the Cisco SD-WAN overlay network domain to which the OMP route belongs).

Option A and C

Reference:-
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/routing/vEdge-20-x/routing-book/m-unicast-routing.html

choices.A: TLOC public and private address, carrier, and preference
choices.B: source and destination IP address, MAC, and site ID
choices.E: TLOC public and private address, tunnel ID, and performance
choices.C: system IP address, link color, and encapsulation
choices.D: VPN ID, local site network, and BGP next-hop IP address

questions.question_text: Which two hardware platforms support Cisco IOS XE SD-WAN images? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AE
B,C,D is wrong answer, so the correct answer is A and E

Selected Answer: AE
Options A & E are the correct answers. 
ASR-1K & ISR-4K platforms from the list.

comments.content: no such thing as an ISR 9300.

discussion.content:
The two hardware platforms that support Cisco IOS XE SD-WAN images are:

A. ISR4000 series
B. ISR9300 series

Therefore, the correct answers are A. ISR4000 series and B. ISR9300 series.

This question is asking which IOS XE SD-WAN images are supported, so it should fall into one of the following categories: 
1. ISR/ASR/C8000/IR
2. ENCS
3. vEdge Cloud & CSR 1000v
vEdge-1000 (or similar) is running Viptela OS

That's correct. Also, the new Cisco Catalyst 8X00 Series Edge Platforms do support.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/sdwan-xe-gs-book/install-upgrade-17-2-later.html

questions.question_text: For data plane resiliency, what does the Cisco SD-WAN software implement?

discussion.content:
For data plane resiliency, the Cisco SD-WAN software implements standard protocol mechanisms, specifically Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD), which runs on the secure IPsec tunnels between routers. 

Source:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/optimization-ha/vedge/network-optimization-high-availability-book/high-availability.html

choices.B: establishing affinity between vSmart controllers and WAN Edge routers

discussion.content: So is the time zone doesn't matter?

Selected Answer: C
C is correct answer

Selected Answer: C
Encapsulation ipsec on VPN 0 interface for vManage is incorrect. 
C is correct.

choices.A: Configure the timezone on vBond to Europe/London.
choices.D: Remove the encapsulation ipsec command under the tunnel interface of vBond.
choices.C: Configure a default route on vBond pointing to 172.16.2.254.
choices.B: Configure the encapsulation ipsec command under the tunnel interface on vManage.
